p: Garlic is an important and safe source of bioactive constituents ( Mikaili et al., 2013). Active compound present in garlic is antifungal, antibacterial and decreases blood clotting. The characteristic odor is due to the presence of volatile oil which is released when garlic is crushed or cut. This releases an enzyme that causes the formation of allicin, the component responsible for garlic's odor and therapeutic activity ( Sajid et al., 2019). It also possesses antioxidant properties due to the presence of a sulfur compound S-allylcysteine diallyl disulphide (DDS).
